title: ARAM Matchmaking
body: WHy is ARAM matchmaking so unfair. I've played over 3500 ARAMs, why am I not matched with players with similar stats? I'm constantly being matched with people who have less than 100 ARAMs TOTAL. It's a different game mode and requires different gameplay that these people who do it "for fun" don't understand. When will that be fixed so I'm actually playing with/against people of a similar ARAM skill level. Fix ARAM MMR

replies.body:
Think of the size of our server...
Think of the proportion of players with the same number of aram games as you...
Think of how many of those players that would be in que at the same time as you....
Like HeartVine said, ARAM isn't really skill based due to the randomly generated champions.

Yeah I hate it when I get people that don't take it seriously. "It's just ARAM, man."

I queue with my level 30 friend and sometimes half the people we play with just can't play the game.

It's not even about not being able to play specific champions well, it's basic stuff... like positioning, focus, engaging properly, etc.

I agree although I have a different issue that I would like to raise.
Two different points to take into account.
One - a person creates another account and only purchases the players they are pro with to reduce the (randomness) of getting characters that they are not good at and increases the chance of getting a character they like.
Two - you use your account that has almost all characters, bear in mind normal people are not pro at all characters now this increases the chance of getting a character that you can not play well essentially you are penalised for having more characters.

Summarisation is now the person who is honest and likes the versatility of picking in normal modes is being penalised for owning more characters in ARAM.

I totally understand where you're coming from (3500+ aram games as well :P) but due to randomly chosen champions and not everyone excelling at every champion, it's too difficult to fully achieve what you describe. Even so, not everyone has every champion/a large champion pool so someone with a similar skill level may only have achieved so in ARAM by mastering a small champion pool which they "luckily" get everytime(e.g. good poke champions like kogmaw, ziggs or aoe/global ults) and in doing so just makes it harder when they play a champion they arent very good at (like someone from the free rotation (lol ocean week) or a champion they recently purchased).

Even at an equal skill level ,one team can just dominate when they have a good team composition. Just be happy that you're better than players who only main a few champs :p
Talking about random-number-generator based mode, refers to skill... I don't think you realise how it works...
